Articles.Content: How to I make a cone with a flat top in Blender and how do I scale it so it will be 1 meter in the game?

You could make a cylinder and then select only the top vertexes, then scale them smaller.

Also, if Blender is set to Metric measurements, a .5 radius cylinder should be 1 meter in KSP.
Since I'm the biggest Blender noob in Blender history, how do I select only the top vertexes and verify it is metric measurements?

I don't know how to select vertices, but I may be able to help with the metric bit. On the right side of the screen is row of symbols: Render, scene, world, object, etc. If you click on Scene, it open a list of options further down the screen. One of the options is Units, and it is preset to None. Just switch this over to metric and it should be good to go. I THINK!

I learned this from the sticky "complete blender tutorial" on the front page of this forum. It isn't perfect by any means, but it is helpful!

It's not that hard, it relies on shortcut keys a lot thats all.

Tab changes to edit mode, A will select/deselect all, C gives you the vertice picker.

S will scale parts or selected vertices, right click to cancel, left click to confirm,
